body_html:
Are you using the same versions of CUDA and CUDNN with both releases?

Release notes https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/releases say there were some changes to gradient calculations. If you could dump the activation/gradient values from a single step on both versions, initialized from the same checkpoint, that might show something useful.
body_text:
Are you using the same versions of CUDA and CUDNN with both releases?
Release notes https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/releases  say there were some changes to gradient calculations.  If you could dump the activation/gradient values from a single step on both versions, initialized from the same checkpoint, that might show something useful.
body:
Are you using the same versions of CUDA and CUDNN with both releases?

Release notes https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/releases  say there were some changes to gradient calculations.  If you could dump the activation/gradient values from a single step on both versions, initialized from the same checkpoint, that might show something useful.
